They were also permitted to kill all their enemies—including their wives and children—and to utterly destroy everything that threatened them, even to the point of extermination, and to take their possessions as plunder. This decree allowed the Jews to defend themselves with the same power that Haman's decree had granted their enemies.

verses.latin: Et constituta est una dies per omnes provincias in totius regis Assueri imperium, decima tertia mensis duodecimi, qui est Adar.
verses.english: And one specific day was appointed throughout all the provinces in the entire empire of King Ahasuerus for this defense: the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which is Adar. This was the same day that Haman had originally chosen for their destruction.

verses.latin: Igitur exemplum epistolæ, ut in cunctis provinciis publicaretur, jussum est ut omnibus populis notum fieret, paratos esse Judæos in diem ultionis hostibus suis.
verses.english: Therefore, a copy of the decree was to be published in all provinces and made known to all peoples, so that the Jews would be prepared for the day they could defend themselves against their enemies.

verses.latin: Egressique sunt cursores veloces, qui per præceptum regis mittebantur, et protinus edictum pependit in Susan.
verses.english: And the swift couriers, who were sent by the king's command, went out immediately. The decree was publicly posted without delay in the city of Susa.

verses.latin: Mardochæus autem de palatio regis et de conspectu ejus egressus, indutus est vestibus regiæ purpuræ et hyacinthi, portans coronam auream, et amictus palliis byssinis atque coccineis. Omnisque civitas Susan exultavit atque lætata est.
verses.english: But Mordecai, having left the king's palace and his immediate presence, was dressed in royal robes of purple and blue, wearing a golden crown, and clothed in cloaks of fine linen and scarlet. These were all symbols of his new, high honor and authority. And the entire city of Susa rejoiced and was glad at this change in fortune.

verses.latin: Judæis autem lux orta est, et lætitia, et exultatio, et honor.
verses.english: For the Jewish people, a new light of hope had dawned. There was joy, exultation, and great honor for them.

verses.latin: Et per cunctas provincias, et civitates, quocumque regis jussum et edictum venerat, erat Judæis epulum, et lætitia, et convivia, et dies festus : multique de populis terræ et secta illorum, et religione juncti sunt : formido enim nominis Judaici cunctos invaserat.
verses.english: And in all the provinces and cities where the king's command and decree had arrived, the Jewish people celebrated with feasts, joy, banquets, and a day of festival. Many of the peoples of the land, seeing this turn of events, converted and joined their sect and religion, for the fear and respect for the Jewish people had now fallen upon all.

verses.latin: Igitur tertiodecimo die duodecimi mensis, qui Adar mense vocitatur, quando cunctis Judaeis interfectio parabatur, et hostes eorum inhiabant sanguini, versa vice Judaei victores extiterunt, et de adversariis suis ulti sunt.
verses.english: On the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, called the month of Adar, when the extermination of all the Jews had been planned, and their enemies were eager for their blood, the Jews, instead, became the victors and took vengeance on their adversaries.

verses.latin: Congregati sunt per singulas civitates et oppida et vicos, ut se defenderent, et hostes suos atque persecutores interficerent: nullusque ausus est resistere, eo quod omnium terror invasisset animos.
verses.english: The Jews gathered in every city, town, and village to defend themselves and to kill their enemies and persecutors. No one dared to resist them, because terror had gripped the hearts of all people.

verses.latin: Nam et provinciarum judices, et satrapae, et praesides, et omnis dignitas, quae singulis locis et praeerat, honori Judaeorum detulerunt, eo quod timor Mardochaei eos invaserat.
verses.english: Indeed, the judges of the provinces, the satraps, the governors, and every dignitary who presided over individual places honored the Jews, because the fear of Mordechai had fallen upon them.

verses.latin: Erat enim Mardochai excelsus in palatio, et cunctis provinciis nominis ejus fama pervolarat: nuntiabant enim omnes Mardochaei pueros esse potentes.
verses.english: For Mordechai was powerful in the palace, and the fame of his name had spread throughout all the provinces; for everyone announced that Mordechai's people were mighty.

verses.latin: Itaque percusserunt Judaei omnes inimicos suos plaga magna, interficientes eos, et reddentes eis quod sibi paraverant.
verses.english: So the Jews struck all their enemies with a great slaughter, killing them and giving back to them what they had intended for the Jews.

verses.latin: In Susis quoque civitate interfecerunt Judaei quingentos viros:
verses.english: Also, in the city of Susa, the Jews killed five hundred men.

verses.latin: et Pharsandatha, et Dalphon, et Aspatha,
verses.english: And Pharsandatha, Dalphon, and Aspatha,

verses.latin: et Poratha, et Adalia, et Aridatha,
verses.english: and Poratha, Adalia, and Aridatha,

verses.latin: et Parmastha, et Arisai, et Aridai, et Vajezatha,
verses.english: and Parmastha, Arisai, Aridai, and Vajezatha—

verses.latin: decem filios Aman filii Amadathi adversarii Judaeorum, interfecerunt: sed praedas eorum non diripuerunt.
verses.english: these were the ten sons of Haman, son of Hammedatha, the adversary of the Jews, whom they killed. But they did not take their plunder.

verses.latin: Statimque ad regem numerus eorum, qui fuerant interfecti in Susa, perlatus est.
verses.english: The number of those killed in Susa was immediately reported to the king.

verses.latin: Dixitque rex reginae Esther: In Susa civitate quingentos viros Judaei interfecerunt, et decem filios Aman: quantam putas eos exercuisse caedem in universis provinciis? Quid ultra postulas, et quid vis ut fieri jubeam?
verses.english: The king then said to Queen Esther, "In the city of Susa, the Jews have killed five hundred men, including Haman's ten sons. How great a slaughter do you think they have carried out in all the other provinces? What more do you request, and what else do you want me to command to be done?"

verses.latin: Respondit Esther: Si regi placet, detur et cras Judaeis, qui in Susa sunt, ut faciant sicut et hodie: et decem filii Aman in patibulis suspendantur.
verses.english: Esther replied, "If it pleases the king, let it be granted to the Jews in Susa that they may act tomorrow just as they have acted today. And let Haman's ten sons be hanged on gallows."

verses.latin: Praecepitque rex ut ita fieret. Statimque in Susa edictum regis pependit, et decem filii Aman suspensi sunt.
verses.english: And the king commanded that it should be done. Immediately, the king's decree was proclaimed in Susa, and Haman's ten sons were hanged.

verses.latin: Addideruntque Judaei in Susa quintodecimo die mensis Adar, et interfecerunt trecentos viros: nec eorum praedas tulerunt.
verses.english: The Jews in Susa also continued on the fifteenth day of the month of Adar and killed three hundred more men, but they did not take their plunder.

verses.latin: Illi vero Judaei, qui in ceteris provinciis morabantur, congregati sunt, ut defenderent animas suas, et persequerentur inimicos suos: et interfecerunt de his qui eos oderant, septuaginta quinque millia, et nihil de facultatibus eorum attigerunt.
verses.english: But the Jews who lived in the other provinces gathered to defend their lives and to pursue their enemies. They killed seventy-five thousand of those who hated them, and they touched none of their possessions.

verses.latin: Et haec cuncta facta sunt tertiodecimo die mensis Adar: quartodecimo autem die ejusdem mensis, cessaverunt ab omni caede, et epulis ac laetitiae vacaverunt.
verses.english: All these things were done on the thirteenth day of the month of Adar. On the fourteenth day of the same month, they ceased all killing and dedicated themselves to feasting and rejoicing.

verses.latin: Illi vero, qui in Susa interfecerant, tam tertiodecimo quam quintodecimo die mensis Adar, in utroque pariter pugnaverunt, et in quintodecimo cessaverunt. Et propterea est observatum a Judaeis qui in oppidis morabantur, ut quartadecimam diei Adar diem laetitiae et conviviis statuerent,
verses.english: However, those who had carried out the killing in Susa fought both on the thirteenth and the fifteenth days of the month of Adar; they ceased on the fifteenth. Therefore, it has been observed by the Jews who lived in the walled towns that they should appoint the fourteenth day of Adar as a day of joy and feasting,

verses.latin: et diem festum, in quo sibi invicem mittant ciborum portiones. Qui autem in urbibus non muratis, et in vicis positi sunt, quartumdecimum diem mensis Adar pro die laetitiae et epularum decernunt, et ut in conviviis laeti sint, sibique invicem mittant escas.
verses.english: and a festive day on which they send portions of food to one another. But those who are in unwalled cities and in villages decree the fourteenth day of the month of Adar as a day of joy and feasting, so that they may be joyful in their celebrations and send food to one another.

verses.latin: Scripsit itaque Mardochai omnia haec, et misit litteras ad omnes Judaeos, qui in cunctis regis Artaxerxis provinciis morabantur, tam prope quam procul,
verses.english: So Mordechai wrote down all these things and sent letters to all the Jews who lived in all the provinces of King Artaxerxes, both near and far,

verses.latin: ut quartumdecimum et quintumdecimum diem mensis Adar statuerent sibi annuos dies festos,
verses.english: that they should establish the fourteenth and fifteenth days of the month of Adar as annual festive days for themselves.

verses.latin: eo quod in ipsis ulti sunt Judaei de inimicis suis, et luctus atque tristitia in laetitiam gaudiumque conversum est, ut facerent dies epularum et laetitiae, et sibi invicem ciborum portiones mitterent, et pauperum ac egenorum largirentur eleemosynas.
verses.english: This was because on those days, the Jews had been avenged on their enemies, and their sorrow and sadness had been turned into joy and gladness. They were to make them days of feasting and rejoicing, and to send portions of food to one another, and to give alms to the poor and needy.

verses.latin: Et susceperunt Judaei in consuetudinem omnia quae facere coeperant, et quae Mardochai eis scripserat:
verses.english: And the Jews took into custom all that they had begun to do and all that Mordechai had written to them.

verses.latin: eo quod Aman, filius Amadathi stirpis Agag, adversarius et hostis Judaeorum, cogitaverat contra illos malum, ut interficeret eos, et delevisset: et jecerat phur, quod interpretatur sortem.
verses.english: This was because Haman, son of Hammedatha, of the race of Agag, the adversary and enemy of the Jews, had plotted evil against them to kill and destroy them; and he had cast "pur," which means "the lot."

verses.latin: Et postea introierat ad regem, ut juberet Judaeos perire: et Esther intercesserat ad regem. Et jussit ex regis sententia epistolis quoque illius et malitiae, quae in Judaeos excogitaverat, impiissimum ejus consilium in caput ejus et filiorum ejus recidere, et in patibulis suspendi eum, et prolem ejus.
verses.english: And afterwards, when he had gone in to the king to order the Jews to perish, Esther interceded with the king. And by the king's decision, it was commanded that Haman's wicked scheme, which he had devised against the Jews through his letters and malice, should recoil upon his own head and the heads of his sons, and that he and his offspring should be hanged on gallows.

verses.latin: Et ex illo vocari dies isti Phurim, id est Sortium, ex eo quod Phur, id est sors, jacta est: et omnia quae gesta fuerant, et quae deinceps acciderant,
verses.english: And from that time, these days were called Purim, that is, "of Lots," because "pur," that is, "the lot," had been cast. And all that had happened, and what then occurred,

verses.latin: suscipere Judaei, super se, et semen suum, et super cunctos qui eis vellent adjungi, ut nulli liceat transgredi, et dies istos festos in obsequium sibi sempiternum tenerent de generatione in generationem:
verses.english: the Jews resolved for themselves, and for their descendants, and for all who wished to join them, that no one should be permitted to transgress, and that they should keep these festive days as an everlasting observance for themselves from generation to generation.

verses.latin: hos dies esse commemorabiles et sollemnes in universo mundo, per singulas familias, et civitates, et provincias: nec ullum obolescere diem festum, sed jugi celebritate revocari.
verses.english: These days were to be remembered and solemnized throughout the entire world, by individual families, and cities, and provinces. No festive day was to be allowed to fall into disuse, but rather to be continually renewed with celebration.

verses.latin: Scripseruntque Esther regina filia Abihaël, et Mardochai Judaeus, totum potestatis suae, ut firmaret hanc secundam epistolam Phurim.
verses.english: Queen Esther, daughter of Abihail, and Mordechai the Jew, then wrote with all their authority to confirm this second letter concerning Purim.

verses.latin: Et miserunt ad omnes Judaeos, qui in centum viginti septem provinciis regis Artaxerxis erant, verba pacis et veritatis:
verses.english: And they sent words of peace and truth to all the Jews who were in the one hundred twenty-seven provinces of King Artaxerxes,

verses.latin: et jussit observari dies Sortium, et suo tempore celebrari, sicut constituerat Mardochai Judaeus, et Esther regina, et illi statuerant sibi et semini suo, jejunia atque clamores, et laetitiam.
verses.english: and commanded that the days of the Lots should be observed and celebrated at their appointed time, just as Mordechai the Jew and Queen Esther had established, and as they themselves had ordained for themselves and their descendants, with fasting, lamentation, and rejoicing.

verses.latin: Et omnia quae ad Phurim pertinent, in uno volumine continentur, et mandati illius probata est fides.
verses.english: And all things pertaining to Purim are contained in one volume, and the authenticity of that command has been proven.

verses.latin: Et scripsit Assuerus rex tributum in omni terra, et in insulis maris.
verses.english: King Ahasuerus then issued a decree for a tax throughout his entire kingdom and extending even to the farthest islands.

verses.latin: Omnia autem opera illius, et fortitudo, et dignitas, atque potentia, qua exaltavit Mardochaeum, scripta sunt in libris Medorum, atque Persarum:
verses.english: All the accomplishments of his reign, his mighty acts, his imperial glory, and the powerful position to which he elevated Mordecai, are recorded in the official chronicles of the kingdoms of Media and Persia.

verses.latin: Et quomodo Mardochaeus Iudaeus secundus a rege Assuero fuerit, et magnus apud Iudaeos, et acceptus plebi fratrum suorum, quaerens bona populi sui, et loquens ea quae ad utilitatem multorum pertinerent.
verses.english: And how Mordecai, a Jew, became the second highest authority after King Ahasuerus; he was greatly respected among his own people, the Jews, and was highly esteemed by all his kinsmen, always working for the welfare of his people and speaking words that served the benefit of many.
